defs: any of the structural part or subordinate division, of poetical body of a literary work.
any of several means, as knowledge, practice, required for accomplishing of a poetical work.
the main theme, essence of poetry in general or of a poetical work.
the unique joy or happiness derived from literary works.
the experience of delicate and sensitive feelings got from poetical works or the appeal to the emotions that literature has on the reader.
a literary work imitating the characteristic style of some other work, but lacking the poetical qualities.
(rhet.) a figure of speech in which a relevant assertion suggests an inference not actually connected with the subject in hand or vice versa.
an expression, as a metaphor or simile, using words in a nonliteral sense or unusual manner to add vividness, beauty, etc. to what is said or written; a figure of speech.
= ಕಾವ್ಯಾಲಂಕಾರ.
= ಕಾವ್ಯಾವಲೋಕನ.
the critical consideration, judgement, and evaluation of literary work; a comment, review, article, etc. expressing such analysis and judgement.
the act or an instance of moving rapidly in a circular manner; a whirling.
the state of being carried away by joy, love, etc.; excited state of the mind; rapture; ecstasy.
confusion; agitation of the mind.
brightness; radiance; brilliance; lustre.

the grass Sorghum nitidum (= Andropogon serratus) of Poaceae family.

ಕಾಸಿನಸರ2 kāsina sara a necklace which is attached with small round gold plates; ಕಾಸಿಗೂ ಕಡೆ kāsigū kaḍe absolutely worthless; ಕಾಸಿಗೆ ತಕ್ಕ ಕಜ್ಜಾಯ kāsige takka kajjāya something that costs little and is of very bad quality; cheap and nasty; cheapness hardly ensures good quality; ಮೂರು ಕಾಸಿಗೂ ಕೇಳದಿರು mūru kāsigū kēḷadiru to look at (something) as completely worthless; ಕಾಸಿಗೆ ಕಾಸು ಗಂಟುಹಾಕು kāsige kāsu gaṇṭu hāku to accumulate money in a stingy manner, even at the epense of personal comfort; ಕಾಸಿಗೊಂದು ಕೊಸರಿಗೆ ಒಂದು (ಎರಡು) kāsigondu k osarige ondu (eraḍu) very cheap and available in plenty; ಕಾಸಿದ್ದರೆ ಕೈಲಾಸ kāsiddare kailāsa comforts, enjoyments, preference in society, etc. are meant only for rich; ಕಾಸಿದ್ದವರು ಕೈಲಾಸಕ್ಕೆ ಹೋಗುತ್ತಾರೆ kāsiddavaru kailāsakke hōguttāre they who have got good store of butter my lay it thick on their bread; ಕಾಸು ಇಲ್ಲದವ ಕಲ್ಲಿಗೆ ಸಮ kāsu illadava kallige sama he who has no money, has neither friends nor credit.

time - a) the system of those sequential relations that any event has to any other, as past, present or future; indefinite and continuous duration regarded as that in which events succeed one another; b) the period between two events or during which something exists, happens or acts; measured or measurable interval; c) any period in the history of man or of the universe, often esp. with reference to a characteristic social structure, set of customs, famous person living then, etc. d) a definite point of time, as indicated by a clock; e) an indefinite period extending into the future; f) a particular period in a day, year; g) an appointed, favourable, proper or convenient time; h) (musc.) relative rapidity of movement; the rate of speed at which a composition or passage is played; tempo.
a period of 12 months (occasionally, 13 months in some calendars); a year.
any of the two fortnights of a lunar month.
cessation of life; death.
